page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: The canal is called the Ashby de la Zouch canal. It flows from the North to South West over a quarter of the area. There are six bridges which cross over the canal. Five of these bridges link up the farms and their land. The canal itself was not overgrown but it has reeds and grasses on the edge. The towpath is overgrown.There are nettles growing over the path and it is really muddy. Some of the bridges, which are numbered, are old but the sides have been built up to make them safer for cattle crossing. In the old days they had been lower so that the hubs on the wheels of the farm carts could stick out because the bridges were quite narrow. A series of electricity pylons follow the line of the canal.
